verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:1
verses.text: Demonstration VI.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:2
verses.text: —Of Monks.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:4
verses.text: Expedient is the word that I speak and worthy of acceptance:—Let us now awake from our sleep, and lift up both our hearts and hands to God towards heaven; lest suddenly the Lord of the house come, that when He comes He may find us in watchfulness.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:5
verses.text: Let us observe the appointed time of the glorious bridegroom, that we may enter with Him into His bride-chamber.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:6
verses.text: Let us prepare oil for our lamps that we may go forth to meet Him with joy.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:7
verses.text: Let us make ready provision for our abiding-place, for the way that is narrow and strait.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:8
verses.text: And let us put away and cast from us all uncleanness, and put on wedding garments.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:9
verses.text: Let us trade with the silver that we have received, that we may be called diligent servants.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:10
verses.text: Let us be constant in prayer, that we may pass by the place where fear dwells.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:11
verses.text: Let us cleanse our heart from iniquity, that we may see the Lofty One in His honour.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:12
verses.text: Let us be merciful, as it is written, that God may have mercy upon us.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:13
verses.text: Let there be peace amongst us, that we may be called the brethren of Christ.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:14
verses.text: Let us hunger for righteousness, that we may be satisfied from the table of His Kingdom.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:15
verses.text: Let us be the salt of truth, that we may not become food for the serpent.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:16
verses.text: Let us purge our seed from thorns, that we may produce fruit a hundred-fold.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:17
verses.text: Let us found our building on the rock, that it may not be shaken by the winds and waves.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:18
verses.text: Let us be vessels unto honour that we may be required by the Lord for His use.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:19
verses.text: Let us sell all our possessions, and buy for ourselves the pearl, that we may be rich.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:20
verses.text: Let us lay up our treasures in heaven, that when we come we may open them and have pleasure in them.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:21
verses.text: Let us visit our Lord in the persons of the sick, that He may invite us to stand at His right hand.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:22
verses.text: Let us hate ourselves and love Christ, as He loved us and gave Himself up for our sakes.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:23
verses.text: Let us honour the spirit of Christ, that we may receive grace from Him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:24
verses.text: Let us be strangers to the world, even as Christ was not of it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:25
verses.text: Let us be humble and mild, that we may inherit the land of life.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:26
verses.text: Let us be unflagging in His service, that He may cause us to serve in the abode of the saints.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:27
verses.text: Let us pray His prayer in purity, that it may have access to the Lord of Majesty.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:28
verses.text: Let us be partakers in His suffering, that so we may also rise up in His resurrection.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:29
verses.text: Let us bear His sign upon our bodies, that we may be delivered from the wrath to come.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:30
verses.text: For fearful is the day in which He will come, and who is able to endure it?  Furious and hot is His wrath, and it will destroy all the wicked.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:31
verses.text: Let us set upon our head the helmet of redemption, that we may not be wounded and die in the battle.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:32
verses.text: Let us gird our loins with truth, that we may not be found impotent in the contest.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:33
verses.text: Let us arise and awaken Christ, that He may still the stormy blasts from us.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:34
verses.text: Let us take as a shield against the Evil One, the preparation of the Gospel of our Redeemer.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:35
verses.text: Let us receive power from our Lord to tread upon snakes and scorpions.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:36
verses.text: Let us lay aside from us wrath, with all fury and malice.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:37
verses.text: Let no reviling proceed out of our mouth, with which we pray unto God.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:38
verses.text: Let us not be cursers, that we may be delivered from the curse of the law.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:39
verses.text: Let us be diligent workers, that we may obtain our reward with those of old.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:40
verses.text: Let us take up the burden of the day, that we may seek a more abundant reward.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:41
verses.text: Let us not be idle workers, for lo! our Lord has hired us for His vineyard.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:42
verses.text: Let us be planted as vines in the midst of His vineyard, for it is the true vineyard.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:43
verses.text: Let us be fruitful vines, that we may not be uprooted out of His vineyard.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:44
verses.text: Let us be a sweet odour, that our fragrance may breathe forth to all around.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:45
verses.text: Let us be poor in the world, and let us enrich many by the doctrine of our Lord.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:46
verses.text: Let us not call anyone our father in the earth, that we may be the children of the Father which is in heaven.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:47
verses.text: Though we have nothing, yet we possess all things.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:48
verses.text: Though no man know us, yet they that have knowledge of us are many.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:49
verses.text: Let us rejoice in our hope at every time, that He Who is our hope and our Redeemer may rejoice in us.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:50
verses.text: Let us judge ourselves righteously and condemn ourselves, that we may not hang down our faces before the judges who shall sit upon thrones and judge the tribes.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:51
verses.text: Let us take to ourselves, as armour for the contest, the preparation of the Gospel.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:52
verses.text: Let us knock at the door of heaven, that it may be opened before us, and we may enter in through it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:53
verses.text: Let us diligently ask for mercy, that we may receive whatsoever is necessary for us.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:54
verses.text: Let us seek His Kingdom and His righteousness, that we may receive increase in the land.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:55
verses.text: Let us think upon the things which are above, on the heavenly things, and meditate on them, where Christ has been lifted up and exalted.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:56
verses.text: But let us forsake the world which is not ours, that we may arrive at the place to which we have been invited.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:57
verses.text: Let us raise up our eyes on high, that we may see the splendour which shall be revealed.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:58
verses.text: Let us lift up our wings as eagles, that we may see the body there where it is.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:59
verses.text: Let us prepare as offerings for the King desirable fruits, fasting and prayer.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:60
verses.text: Let us guard His pledge in purity, that He may trust us over all His treasury.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:61
verses.text: For whosoever deals falsely with His pledge, they suffer him not to enter into the treasure-house.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:62
verses.text: Let us be careful of the body of Christ, that our bodies may rise at the sound of the trumpet.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:63
verses.text: Let us hearken to the voice of the bridegroom, that we may go in with Him into the bride-chamber.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:64
verses.text: Let us prepare the marriage-gift for His bridal day, and let us go forth to meet Him with joy.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:65
verses.text: Let us put on holy raiment, that we may recline in the chief place of the elect.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:66
verses.text: Whosoever puts not on wedding raiment, they cast him out into outer darkness.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:67
verses.text: Whosoever excuses himself from the wedding shall not taste the feast.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:68
verses.text: Whosoever loves fields and merchandise, shall be shut out of the city of Saints.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:69
verses.text: Whosoever does not bear fruit in the vineyard, shall be uprooted and cast out to torment.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:70
verses.text: Whosoever has received money from his Lord, let him return it to its Giver with its increase.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:71
verses.text: Whosoever desires to become a merchant, let, him buy for himself the field and the treasure that is in it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:72
verses.text: Whosoever receives the good seed, let him purge his land from thorns.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:73
verses.text: Whosoever desires to be a fisherman, let him cast forth his net at every time.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:74
verses.text: Whosoever is training for the conflict, let him keep himself from the world.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:75
verses.text: Whosoever wishes to gain the crown, let him run as a winner in the race.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:76
verses.text: Whosoever wishes to go down into the course to contend, let him learn to (contend) against his adversary.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:77
verses.text: Whosoever wishes to go down to the battle, let him take unto him armour wherewith to fight, and let him purify himself at every time.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:78
verses.text: Whosoever adopts the likeness of angels, let him be a stranger to men.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:79
verses.text: Whosoever takes upon him the yoke of the saints, let him remove from him getting and spending.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:80
verses.text: Whosoever desires to gain himself, let him remove from him the gain of the world.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:81
verses.text: Whosoever loves the abode that is in heaven, let him not toil at the building of clay that will fall.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:82
verses.text: Whosoever is expectant of being caught up in the clouds, let him not make for himself adorned chariots.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:83
verses.text: Whosoever is expectant of the marriage-feast of the Bridegroom, let him not love the feast of this present time.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:84
verses.text: Whosoever wishes to have pleasure in the banquet reserved there, let him remove drunkenness from himself.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:85
verses.text: Whosoever prepares himself for the supper, let him not excuse himself, nor be a merchant.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:86
verses.text: Whosoever he be on whom the good seed falls, let him not allow the Evil One to sow tares in him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:87
verses.text: Whosoever has begun to build a tower, let him count up all the cost thereof.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:88
verses.text: Whosoever builds ought to finish, that he be not a laughing-stock to them that pass by the way.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:89
verses.text: Whosoever sets his building on the rock, let him make its foundations deep, that it may not be cast down by the billows.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:90
verses.text: Whosoever wishes to fly from the darkness, let him walk while he has light.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:91
verses.text: Whosoever fears to fly in winter, let him prepare himself from the summer-time.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:92
verses.text: Whosoever looks forward to enter into rest, let him make ready his provision for the Sabbath.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:93
verses.text: Whosoever begs forgiveness of his Lord, let him also forgive his debtor.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:94
verses.text: Whosoever does not demand back a hundred dinars, his Lord forgives him ten thousand talents.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:95
verses.text: Whosoever casts down his Lord's money on the banker's table, will not be called an unprofitable servant.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:96
verses.text: Whosoever loves humility, shall be heir in the land of life.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:97
verses.text: Whosoever wishes to make peace, shall be one of the sons of God.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:98
verses.text: Whosoever knows the will of his Lord, let him do that will, that he may not be beaten much.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:99
verses.text: Whosoever cleanses his heart from deceits, His eyes shall behold the King in his beauty.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:100
verses.text: Whosoever receives the Spirit of Christ, let him adorn his inner man.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:101
verses.text: Whosoever is called the temple of God, let him purify his body from all uncleanness.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:102
verses.text: Whosoever grieves the Spirit of Christ, shall not raise up his head from griefs.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:103
verses.text: Whosoever receives the body of Christ, let him keep his body from all uncleanness.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:104
verses.text: Whosoever casts off the old man, let him not turn back to his former works.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:105
verses.text: Whosoever puts on the new man, let him keep himself from all filthiness.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:106
verses.text: Whosoever has put on armour from the water (of baptism), let him not put off his armour that he may not be condemned.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:107
verses.text: Whosoever takes up the shield against the Evil One, let him keep himself from the darts which he hurls at him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:108
verses.text: Whosoever shall draw back, his Lord has no pleasure in him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:109
verses.text: Whosoever thinks upon the Law of his Lord, shall not be troubled with the thoughts of this world.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:110
verses.text: Whosoever meditates on the Law of his Lord, is like a tree planted by the waters.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:111
verses.text: Whosoever again has trust in his Lord, is like a tree that is set out by the river.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:112
verses.text: Whosoever puts his trust in man shall receive the curses of Jeremiah.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:113
verses.text: Whosoever is invited to the Bridegroom, let him prepare himself.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:114
verses.text: Whosoever has lighted his lamp, let him not suffer it to go out.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:115
verses.text: Whosoever is expectant of the marriage-cry, let him take oil in his vessel.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:116
verses.text: Whosoever is keeper of the door, let him be on the watch for his Master.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:117
verses.text: Whosoever loves virginity, let him become like Elijah.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:118
verses.text: Whosoever takes up the yoke of the Saints, let him sit and be silent.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:119
verses.text: Whosoever loves peace, let him look for his Master as the hope of life.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:121
verses.text: For, my beloved, our adversary is skilful.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:122
verses.text: He that contends against us is crafty.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:123
verses.text: Against the brave and the renowned does he prepare himself, that they may be weakened.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:124
verses.text: For the feeble are his own, nor does he fight with the captivity that are made captive to him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:125
verses.text: He that has wings flees from him and the darts that he hurls at him do not reach him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:126
verses.text: They that are spiritual see him when he assails, and his panoply has no power upon their bodies.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:127
verses.text: All the children of light are without fear of him, because the darkness flies from before the light.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:128
verses.text: The children of the Good fear not the Evil, for He hath given him to be trampled by their feet.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:129
verses.text: When he makes himself like darkness unto them, they become light.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:130
verses.text: And when he creeps upon them like a serpent, they become salt, whereof he cannot eat.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:131
verses.text: If he makes himself like the asp unto them, then they become like babes.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:132
verses.text: If he comes in upon them in the lust of food, they, like our Redeemer, conquer him by fasting.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:133
verses.text: And if he wishes to contend with them by the lust of the eyes, they lift up their eyes to the height of heaven.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:134
verses.text: If he wishes by enticements to overcome them, they do not afford him a hearing.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:135
verses.text: If he wishes openly to strive with them, lo! they are clothed in panoply and stand up against him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:136
verses.text: If he wishes to come in against them by sleep, they are wakeful and vigilant and sing psalms and pray.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:137
verses.text: If he allures them by possessions, they give them to the poor.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:138
verses.text: If he comes in as sweetness against them, they taste it not, knowing that he is bitter.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:139
verses.text: If he inflames them with the desire of Eve, they dwell alone, and not with the daughters of Eve.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:141
verses.text: For it was through Eve that he came in upon Adam, and Adam was enticed because of his inexperience.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:142
verses.text: And again he came in against Joseph through his master's wife, but Joseph was acquainted with his craftiness and would not afford him a hearing.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:143
verses.text: Through a woman he fought with Samson, until he took away his Nazariteship.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:144
verses.text: Reuben was the first-born of all his brethren, and through his father's wife, (the adversary) cast a blemish upon him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:145
verses.text: Aaron was the great high-priest of the house of Israel, and through Miriam his sister he envied Moses.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:146
verses.text: Moses was sent to deliver the people from Egypt, and took with him the woman who advised him to shameful acts, and the Lord met with Moses, and desired to slay him, till he sent back his wife to Midian.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:147
verses.text: David was victorious in all his battles, yet through means of a daughter of Eve there was found a blemish in him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:148
verses.text: Amnon was beautiful and fair in countenance, yet (the adversary) took him captive by desire for his sister, and Absalom slew him on account of the humbling of Tamar.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:149
verses.text: Solomon was greater than all the kings of the earth, yet in the days of his old age his wives led his heart astray.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:150
verses.text: Through Jezebel, daughter of Ethbaal, the wickedness of Ahab was increased, and he became altogether a heathen.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:151
verses.text: Furthermore, the adversary tempted Job through his children and his possessions, and when he could not prevail over him, he went and brought against him his armour, and he came, bringing with him a daughter of Eve, who had caused Adam to sink, and through her mouth he said to Job, her righteous husband:—Curse God.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:152
verses.text: But Job rejected her counsel.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:153
verses.text: King Asa also conquered the Accursed-of-life, when he wished to come in against him, through his mother.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:154
verses.text: For Asa knew his craftiness and removed his mother from her high estate, and cut in pieces her idol and cast it down.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:155
verses.text: John was greater than all the prophets, yet Herod slew him because of the dancing of a daughter of Eve.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:156
verses.text: Haman was wealthy and third in honour from the King, yet his wife counselled him to destroy the Jews.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:157
verses.text: Zimri was head of the tribe of Simeon, yet Cozbi, daughter of the chiefs of Midian, overthrew him, and because of one woman twenty-four thousand of Israel fell in one day.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:159
verses.text: Therefore, my brethren, if any man who is a monk or a saint, who loves the solitary life, yet desires that a woman, bound by monastic vow like himself, should dwell with him, it would be better for him in that case to take (to wife) a woman openly and not be made wanton by lust.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:160
verses.text: So also again the woman, if she be not separated from the solitary, it is better for her to marry openly.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:161
verses.text: Woman then ought to dwell with woman, and man to dwell with man.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:162
verses.text: And also whatever man desires to continue in holiness, let not his spouse dwell with him, lest he turn back to his former condition, and so be esteemed an adulterer.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:163
verses.text: Therefore this counsel is becoming and right and good, that I give to myself and you, my beloved solitaries, who do not take wives, and to the virgins who do not marry, and to those who have loved holiness.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:164
verses.text: It is just and right and becoming, that even if a man should be distressed, he should continue alone.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:165
verses.text: And thus it becomes him to dwell, as it is written in the Prophet Jeremiah:—Blessed is the man who shall take up Thy yoke in his youth, and sit alone and be silent, because he has taken upon him Thy yoke.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:166
verses.text: For thus, my beloved, it becomes him who takes up the yoke of Christ, to preserve his yoke in purity.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:168
verses.text: For thus it is written, my beloved, concerning Moses, that from the time the Holy One was revealed to him, he also loved holiness.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:169
verses.text: And from the time he was sanctified, his wife ministered not to him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:170
verses.text: But it is thus written:—Joshua, the son of Nun, was the minister of Moses from his childhood.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:171
verses.text: And of Joshua again it is thus written concerning him, that he used not to depart from the tabernacle.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:172
verses.text: And the temporal tabernacle was not ministered to by a woman, because the Law did not allow women to enter the temporal tabernacle, but even when they came to pray, they used to pray at the door of the temporal tabernacle, and then turn back.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:173
verses.text: Moreover, he commanded the Priests, that at the time of their ministry they should continue in holiness, and should not know their wives.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:174
verses.text: And also concerning Elijah it is thus written, that at one time he dwelt in Mount Carmel, and at another he dwelt at the brook Cherith, and was ministered to by his disciple; and because his heart was in heaven, the bird of heaven used to bring sustenance to him; and because he took upon him the likeness of the angels of heaven, those very angels brought him bread and water when he was fleeing from before Jezebel.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:175
verses.text: And because he set all his thought in heaven, he was caught up in the chariot of fire to heaven, and there his dwelling-place was established for ever.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:176
verses.text: Elisha also walked in the footsteps of his Master.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:177
verses.text: He used to dwell in the upper chamber of the Shunamite, and was ministered to by his disciple.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:178
verses.text: For thus the Shunamite said;—He is a holy Prophet of God and passes by us continually, for thus it becomes his holiness that we should make for him an upper chamber and do for him the service that is (necessary) in it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:179
verses.text: Now what was the service necessary in the upper chamber of Elisha?  Clearly the bed and table and stool and lamp-stand only.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:180
verses.text: But what shall we say of John?  He also used to dwell amongst men, and preserved his virginity honourably, and received the Spirit of God.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:181
verses.text: Moreover, the blessed Apostle said concerning himself and concerning Barnabas:—Had we then not power to eat and to drink and to lead about wives with us?  But it was not becoming or right.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:183
verses.text: Therefore, brethren, because we know and have seen that from the beginning it was through woman that the adversary had access unto men, and to the end he will accomplish it by her—for she is the weapon of Satan, and through her he fights against the champions.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:184
verses.text: Through her he makes music at every time, for she became as a harp for him from the first day.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:185
verses.text: For because of her the curse of the Law was established, and because of her the promise unto death was made.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:186
verses.text: For with pangs she bears children and delivers them to death.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:187
verses.text: Because of her the earth was cursed, that it should bring forth thorns and tares.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:188
verses.text: Accordingly, by the coming of the offspring of the Blessed Mary the thorns are uprooted, the sweat wiped away, the fig-tree cursed, the dust made salt, the curse nailed to the cross, the edge of the sword removed from before the tree of life and it given as food to the faithful, and Paradise promised to the blessed and to virgins and to the saints.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:189
verses.text: So the fruit of the tree of life is given as food to the faithful and to virgins, and to those that do the will of God has the door been opened and the way made plain.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:190
verses.text: And the fountain flows and gives drink to the thirsty.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:191
verses.text: The table is laid and the supper prepared.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:192
verses.text: The fatted ox is slain and the cup of redemption mixed.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:193
verses.text: The feast is prepared and the Bridegroom at hand, soon to take his place.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:194
verses.text: The apostles have given the invitation and the called are very many.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:195
verses.text: O ye chosen, prepare yourselves.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:196
verses.text: The light has shone forth both bright and fair, and garments not made with hands are prepared.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:197
verses.text: The marriage cry is at hand.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:198
verses.text: The tombs will be opened and the treasures laid bare.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:199
verses.text: The dead shall rise and the living shall fly to meet the King.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:200
verses.text: The banquet is laid, and the cornet shall encourage and the trumpets shall hasten (them).

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:201
verses.text: The Watchers of heaven shall speed, and the throne shall be set for the Judge.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:202
verses.text: He that laboured shall rejoice, and he that was unprofitable shall fear.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:203
verses.text: He that did evil shall not draw nigh unto the Judge.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:204
verses.text: Those on the right hand shall exult, and those on the left shall weep and wail.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:205
verses.text: Those that are in the light shall be glorified, and those that are in the darkness shall groan that they may moisten their tongue.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:206
verses.text: Grace has gone by, and justice reigns.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:207
verses.text: There is no repentance in that place.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:208
verses.text: Winter is at hand; the summer has passed away.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:209
verses.text: The Sabbath of rest has come; toil has ceased.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:210
verses.text: Night has passed away; the light reigns.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:211
verses.text: As to death, its sting is broken and it is swallowed up in life.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:212
verses.text: Those that return to Sheol shall weep and gnash their teeth, and those that go to the Kingdom shall rejoice and exult and dance and sing praises.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:213
verses.text: For those that take not wives shall be ministered to by the Watchers of heaven.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:214
verses.text: Those that preserve chastity shall rest in the sanctuary of the Most High.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:215
verses.text: The Only Begotten Who is from the bosom of His Father shall cause all the solitaries to rejoice.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:216
verses.text: There is there neither male nor female, neither bond nor free, but they all are the children of the Most High.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:217
verses.text: And all the pure virgins who are betrothed to Christ shall light their lamps and with the Bridegroom shall they go into the marriage chamber.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:218
verses.text: All those that are betrothed to Christ are far removed from the curse of the Law, and are redeemed from the condemnation of the daughters of Eve; for they are not wedded to men so as to receive the curses and come into the pains.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:219
verses.text: They take no thought of death, because they do not deliver children to him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:220
verses.text: And in place of a mortal husband, they are betrothed to Christ.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:221
verses.text: And because they do not bear children, there is Given to them the name that is better than sons and daughters.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:222
verses.text: And instead of the groans of the daughters of Eve, they utter the songs of the Bridegroom.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:223
verses.text: The wedding-feast of the daughters of Eve continues for but seven days; but for these (virgins) is the Bridegroom who departs not for ever.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:224
verses.text: The adornment of the daughters of Eve is wool that wears out and perishes, but the garments of these wear not out.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:225
verses.text: Old age withers the beauty of the daughters of Eve, but the beauty of these shall be renewed in the time of the Resurrection.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:227
verses.text: O ye virgins who have betrothed yourselves to Christ, when one of the monks shall say to one of you, "I will live with thee and minister thou to me," thus shalt thou say unto him:—"To a royal husband am I betrothed, and Him do I serve; and if I leave His service and serve thee, my betrothed will be wroth with me, and will write me a letter of divorce, and will send me away from His house; and while thou seekest to be honoured by me, and I to be honoured by thee, take heed lest hurt come upon me and thee.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:228
verses.text: Take not fire into thy bosom, lest it burn thy garments; but be thou in honour alone, and I also alone will abide in my honour.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:229
verses.text: And as concerning these things which the Bridegroom has prepared for the eternity of his marriage feast, do thou make thee a wedding-gift and prepare thyself to meet Him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:230
verses.text: And as for me, I will make me ready oil, that I may enter in with the wise virgins and may not be kept outside the door with the foolish virgins".

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:232
verses.text: Hearken then, my beloved, unto that which I write unto thee, namely, whatsoever things become solitaries, monks, virgins, saints.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:233
verses.text: Before all things it beseems the man on whom the yoke is laid, that his faith should be firm; as I wrote to thee in the first epistle; that he should be zealous in fasting and prayer; that he should be fervent in the love of Christ; and should be humble and mild and wise.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:234
verses.text: And let his speech be peaceful and pleasant, and his thought be sincere with all.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:235
verses.text: Let him speak his words duly weighing them, and set a barrier to his mouth from harmful words, and let him put far from him hasty laughter.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:236
verses.text: Let him not love the adornment of garments, nor again does it become him to let his hair grow long and adorn it, or to anoint it with sweet-scented unguents.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:237
verses.text: Let him not recline at feastings, nor does it become him to wear gorgeous apparel.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:238
verses.text: Let him not dare to exceed at wine.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:239
verses.text: Let him put far from him proud thoughts.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:240
verses.text: It does not become him to look upon gorgeous apparel, or to wear fine raiment.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:241
verses.text: Let him put away from him a crafty tongue; let him drive from him envy and wrath, and cast away from him crafty lips.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:242
verses.text: The words that are spoken about a man, when he about whom they are spoken is not near, let him not hear nor receive, that he sin not, until he search them out.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:243
verses.text: Mockery is a hateful fault, and to bring it up upon the heart is not right.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:244
verses.text: Let him not lend and take interest, and let him not love avarice.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:245
verses.text: Let him suffer wrong and not do wrong.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:246
verses.text: Furthermore, let him put away from him turmoil, and words of jesting let him not utter.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:247
verses.text: Let him not scorn any man who is repenting of his sins, and let him not mock his brother who is fasting, and him that cannot fast let him not put to shame.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:248
verses.text: Where he is received, let him reprove, and where they receive him not, let him understand his own honour.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:249
verses.text: In an acceptable time let him speak his word; otherwise, let him be silent.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:250
verses.text: Let him not for his belly's sake make himself despised by his begging, and to such an one as fears God let him reveal his secret; but let him keep himself from the evil (man).

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:251
verses.text: Let him not speak in complaisance with a wicked man, nor with his enemy.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:252
verses.text: And so let him contend as to have no enemy at all.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:253
verses.text: When men envy him in that which is good, let him add to his goodness, and let him not be harmed because of envy.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:254
verses.text: When he has, and gives to the poor, let him rejoice; and when he has not, let it not grieve him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:255
verses.text: With a wicked man let him have no converse and with a contemptuous man let him not speak, lest he give himself to contempt.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:256
verses.text: With a blasphemer let him not dispute, lest his Lord be blasphemed on his account.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:257
verses.text: Let him depart from a slanderer, and let no man please another man with speciousness of words.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:258
verses.text: These things beseem solitaries who take up the heavenly yoke, and become disciples of Christ.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:259
verses.text: For thus it befits the disciples of Christ to be like unto Christ their Master.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:261
verses.text: Let us take pattern, my beloved, from our Saviour, Who though He was rich, made Himself poor; and though He was lofty, humbled His Majesty; and though His dwelling place was in heaven, He had no place to lay His head; and though He is to come upon the clouds, yet rode on a colt and so entered Jerusalem; and though He is God and Son of God, He took upon Him the likeness of a servant; and though He was (for others) rest from all weariness, yet was Himself tired with the weariness of the journey; though He was the fountain that quenches thirst, yet Himself thirsted and asked for water; though He was abundance and satisfied our hunger, yet He Himself hungered when He went forth to the wilderness to be tempted; though He was a Watcher that slumbers not, He yet slumbered and slept in the ship in the midst of the sea; and though He was ministered to in the Tabernacle of His Father, yet let Himself be served by the hands of men; though He was the healer of all sick men, yet nails were fastened into His hands; though His mouth brought forth things that were good, yet they gave Him gall to eat; though He injured no man and harmed none, yet He was beaten with stripes and endured shame; and though he was Saviour of all mortals, He delivered Himself to the death of the cross.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:263
verses.text: All this humility did our Saviour show us in Himself.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:264
verses.text: Let us then also humble ourselves, my beloved.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:265
verses.text: When our Lord went outside of His nature, He walked in our nature.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:266
verses.text: Let us abide in our nature, that in the day of judgment He may cause us to partake of His nature.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:267
verses.text: Our Lord took from us a pledge when He went, and He left us a pledge of His own when he ascended.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:268
verses.text: He that was without need, because of our need devised this expedient.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:269
verses.text: What was ours was His even from the beginning, but that which was His, who would have given us?  But true is that which our Lord promised us:—Where I am there ye also shall be.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:270
verses.text: For whatsoever He took of ours, is in honour with Him, and (as) a diadem is bound upon His Head.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:271
verses.text: So also that, which of His we have received, we ought to honour.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:272
verses.text: That which is ours is held in honour with Him who was not in our nature:  let us honour that which is His in His own nature.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:273
verses.text: If we honour Him, we shall go to Him, Who took upon Him of our nature and so ascended.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:274
verses.text: But if we despise Him, He will take away from us that which He has given us.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:275
verses.text: If we deal fraudulently with His pledge, He will there take away that which is His, and will deprive us of all that He has promised us.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:276
verses.text: Let us magnify gloriously the King's Son Who is with us, because a hostage for Him has been taken from us.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:277
verses.text: Whoso holds the King's Son in honour, shall obtain many gifts from the King.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:278
verses.text: That of ours, that is with Him, has sat down in honour and a diadem is bound upon His head, and He has sat down with the King.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:279
verses.text: And we who are poor, what shall we do to the King's Son Who is with us?  He needs nothing from us, but that we should adorn our temples for Him; that when the time is accomplished and He goes to His Father, He may give thanks to Him because of us, because we have honoured Him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:280
verses.text: When He came to us, He had nothing of ours, and also we had nothing of His, though the two natures were His and His Father's.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:281
verses.text: For when Gabriel made announcement to the Blessed Mary who bore Him, the word from on high set out and came, and the word became flesh and dwelt in us.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:282
verses.text: And when He returned to Him that sent Him, He took away, when He went, that which He had not brought, as the Apostle said:—He has taken us up and seated us with Himself in the heavens.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:283
verses.text: And when He went to His Father, He sent to us His Spirit and said to us I am with you till the world shall end.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:284
verses.text: For Christ sitteth at the right hand of His Father, and Christ dwelleth among men.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:285
verses.text: He is sufficient above and beneath, by the wisdom of His Father.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:286
verses.text: And He dwells in many, though He is one, and all the faithful each by each He overshadows from Himself, and fails not, as it is written:—I will divide Him among many.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:287
verses.text: And though He is divided among many, yet He sits at the right hand of His Father.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:288
verses.text: And He is in us and we are in Him, as He said:—Ye are in Me and I am in you.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:289
verses.text: And in another place He said:—I and Father are one.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:291
verses.text: And if anyone, whose conscience lacks knowledge, should dispute about this and say:—"Since Christ is one and His Father is one, how does Christ dwell, and His Father dwell, in faithful men?  And how do righteous men become temples for God that He should dwell in them?  If then it is thus, that to each several faithful man there comes a several Christ, and God Who is in Christ,—if it is so, there are for them Gods many and Christs without number".

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:292
verses.text: But hear, my beloved, the defence that is suited to this argument.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:293
verses.text: From that which is visible let him that has thus said receive instruction.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:294
verses.text: For every man knows that the sun is fixed in the heavens, yet its rays are spread out in the earth, and (light) from it enters by many doors and windows of houses; and wherever the sunshine falls, though it be but as (the measure of) the palm of the hand, it is called the sun.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:295
verses.text: And though it fall in many places, it is thus called, but the real sun itself is in heaven.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:296
verses.text: Therefore, if it is so, have they many suns?  Also the water of the sea is vast, and when thou takest one cup from it, that is called water.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:297
verses.text: And though thou shouldest divide it into a thousand vessels, yet it is called water by its name.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:298
verses.text: Also when thou kindlest fire from fire in many places, the place from whence thou takest it, when thou kindlest it, lacks not, and the fire is called by one name.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:299
verses.text: And because thou dividest it into many places, it does not on that account become possessed of many names.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:300
verses.text: And when thou takest dust from the earth, and castest it into many places, it is not a whit diminished, and also thou canst not call it by many names.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:301
verses.text: Thus also God and His Christ, though they are One, yet dwell in men who are many.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:302
verses.text: And they are in heaven in person, and are diminished in nothing when they dwell in many; as the sun is not a whit diminished in heaven, when its power is poured out in the earth.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:303
verses.text: How much greater then is the power of God, since by the power of God the very sun itself subsists.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:305
verses.text: Again I will remind thee, my beloved, also of that which is written.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:306
verses.text: For thus it is written, that when it was a grievous burden to Moses to lead the camp alone, the Lord said to him:—Lo! will take away of the Spirit that is upon thee, and will put it upon seventy men, elders of Israel.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:307
verses.text: But when He took away some of the Spirit of Moses, and the seventy men were filled with it, Moses nothing lacked, nor could it be known that anything was taken away from his Spirit.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:308
verses.text: Moreover the blessed apostle also said:—God divided of the Spirit of Christ and sent it into the Prophets.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:309
verses.text: And Christ was in nothing injured, for it was not by measure that His Father gave unto Him the Spirit.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:310
verses.text: By this reflection thou canst comprehend that Christ dwells in faithful men; yet Christ suffers no loss though He is divided among many.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:311
verses.text: For the Prophets received of the Spirit of Christ, each one of them as he was able to bear.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:312
verses.text: And of the Spirit of Christ again there is poured forth to-day upon all flesh, and the sons and the daughters prophesy, the old men and the youths, the men-servants and the hand-maids.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:313
verses.text: Something of Christ is in us, yet Christ is in heaven at the right hand of His Father.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:314
verses.text: And Christ received the Spirit not by measure, but His Father loved Him and delivered all into His hands, and gave Him authority over all His treasure.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:315
verses.text: For John said:—Not by measure did the Father give the Spirit to His Son, but loved Him and gave all into His hands.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:316
verses.text: And also our Lord said:—All things have been delivered unto Me by My Father.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:317
verses.text: Again he said:—The Father will not judge any man, but all judgment will He give unto His Son.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:318
verses.text: Again also the Apostle said:—Everything shall be made subject unto Christ except His Father Who hath subjected all unto Him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:319
verses.text: And when everything is made subject unto Him by the Father, then He also shall be made subject to God His Father Who subjected all to Him, and God shall be all in all, and in every man.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:321
verses.text: Our Lord testifies concerning John, that he is the greatest of the Prophets.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:322
verses.text: Yet he received the Spirit by limit, because in that measure in which Elijah received the Spirit, (in the same) John obtained it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:323
verses.text: And as Elijah used to dwell in the wilderness, so also the Spirit of God led John into the wilderness, and he used to dwell in the mountains and caves.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:324
verses.text: The birds sustained Elijah, and John used to eat locusts that fly.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:325
verses.text: Elijah had his loins girded with a girdle of leather; so John had his loins girded with a cincture of leather.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:326
verses.text: Jezebel persecuted Elijah, and Herodias persecuted John.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:327
verses.text: Elijah reproved Ahab, and John reproved Herod.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:328
verses.text: Elijah divided the Jordan, and John opened up baptism.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:329
verses.text: The spirit of Elijah rested twofold upon Elisha, so John laid his hand on our Redeemer, and He received the Spirit not by measure.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:330
verses.text: Elijah opened the heavens and ascended; and John saw the heavens opened, and the Spirit of God which descended and rested upon our Redeemer.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:331
verses.text: Elisha received twofold the Spirit of Elijah; and our Redeemer received that of John and that of heaven.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:332
verses.text: Elisha took the mantle of Elijah, and our Redeemer the imposition of the hand of the priests.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:333
verses.text: Elisha made oil from water, and our Redeemer made wine from water.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:334
verses.text: Elisha satisfied with a little bread a hundred men only; and our Redeemer satisfied with a little bread five thousand men besides children and women.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:335
verses.text: Elisha cleansed Naaman the leper, and our Redeemer cleansed the ten (lepers).

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:336
verses.text: Elisha cursed the children and they were devoured by bears, but our Redeemer blessed the children.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:337
verses.text: The children reviled Elisha, but the children glorified our Redeemer with Hosannas.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:338
verses.text: Elisha cursed Gehazi his servant, and our Redeemer cursed Judas His disciple and blessed all His (other) disciples.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:339
verses.text: Elisha raised to life one dead man only, but our Redeemer raised up three to life.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:340
verses.text: On the bones of Elisha one dead man revived, but when our Saviour descended to the abode of the dead, He quickened many and raised them up.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:341
verses.text: And many are the signs that the Spirit of Christ wrought, which the Prophets received from Him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:343
verses.text: Therefore, my beloved, we also have received of the Spirit of Christ, and Christ dwelleth in us, as it is written that the Spirit said this through the mouth of the Prophet:—I will dwell in them and will walk in them.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:344
verses.text: Therefore let us prepare our temples for the Spirit of Christ, and let us not grieve it that it may not depart from us.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:345
verses.text: Remember the warning that the Apostle gives us:—Grieve not the Holy Spirit whereby ye have been sealed unto the day of redemption.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:346
verses.text: For from baptism do we receive the Spirit of Christ.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:347
verses.text: For in that hour in which the priests invoke the Spirit, the heavens open and it descends and moves upon the waters.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:348
verses.text: And those that are baptized are clothed in it; for the Spirit stays aloof from all that are born of the flesh, until they come to the new birth by water, and then they receive the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:349
verses.text: For in the first birth they are born with an animal souls which is created within man and is not thereafter subject to death, as he said:—Adam became a living soul.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:350
verses.text: But in the second birth, that through baptism, they received the Holy Spirit from a particle of the Godhead, and it is not again subject to death.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:351
verses.text: For when men die, the animal spirit is buried with the body, and sense is taken away from it, but the heavenly spirit that they receive goes according to its nature to Christ.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:352
verses.text: And both these the Apostle has made known, for he said:—The body is buried in animal wise, and rises again in spiritual wise.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:353
verses.text: The Spirit goes back again to Christ according to its nature, for the Apostle said again:—When we shall depart from the body we shall be with our Lord.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:354
verses.text: For the Spirit of Christ, which the spiritual receive, goes to our Lord.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:355
verses.text: And the animal spirit is buried in its nature, and sense is taken away from it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:356
verses.text: Whosoever guards the Spirit of Christ in purity, when it returns to Christ it thus addresses him:—"The body into which I went, and which put me on from the water of the baptism, has kept me in holiness".

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:357
verses.text: And the Holy Spirit will be earnest with Christ for the resurrection of that body which kept Him with purity, and the Spirit will request to be again conjoined to it that that body may rise up in glory.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:358
verses.text: And whatever man there is that receives the Spirit from the water (of baptism) and grieves it, it departs from him until he dies, and returns according to its nature to Christ, and accuses that man of having grieved it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:359
verses.text: And when the time of the final consummation shall have come, and the time of the Resurrection shall have approached, the Holy Spirit, that was kept in purity, receives great power from its nature and comes before Christ and stands at the door of the tombs, where the men are buried that kept it in purity, and awaits the (resurrection) shout.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:360
verses.text: And when the Watchers shall have opened the doors of heaven before the King, then the cornet shall summon, and the trumpets shall sound, and the Spirit that waits for the (resurrection) shout shall hear, and quickly shall open the tombs, and raise up the bodies and whatsoever was buried in them, and shall put on the glory that comes with it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:361
verses.text: And (the Spirit) shall be within for the resurrection of the body, and the glory shall be without for the adornment of the body.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:362
verses.text: And the animal spirit shall be swallowed up in the heavenly Spirit, and the whole man shall become spiritual, since his body is possessed by it (the Spirit).

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:363
verses.text: And death shall be swallowed up in life, and body shall be swallowed up in Spirit.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:364
verses.text: And by the power of the Spirit, that man shall fly up to meet the King and He shall receive him with joy, and Christ shall give thanks for the body that has kept His Spirit in purity.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:366
verses.text: This is the Spirit, my beloved, that the Prophets received, and thus also have we received.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:367
verses.text: And it is not at every time found with those that receive it, but sometimes it returns to Him that sent it, and sometimes it goes to him that receives it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:368
verses.text: Hearken to that which our Lord said:—Despise not one of these little ones that believe on Me, for their angels in heaven do always behold the face of My Father.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:369
verses.text: This Spirit then goes frequently and stands before God and beholds His face, and whosoever injures the temple in which it dwells, it will accuse him before God.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:371
verses.text: I will instruct thee of that which is written, that the Spirit is not at every time found with those that receive it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:372
verses.text: For thus it is written about Saul, that the Holy Spirit, which he received when he was anointed, departed from him, because he grieved it, and God sent to him instead of it a vexing spirit.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:373
verses.text: And whenever he was afflicted by the evil spirit, David used to play upon the harp, and the Holy Spirit, which David received when he was anointed, would come, and the evil spirit that was vexing Saul, would flee from before it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:374
verses.text: So the Holy Spirit that David received was not found with him at every time.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:375
verses.text: As long as he was playing the harp, then it used to come.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:376
verses.text: For had it been with him always, it would not have allowed him to sin with the wife of Uriah.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:377
verses.text: For when he was praying about his sins, and was confessing his offences before God, he said thus:—Take not Thy holy spirit from me.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:378
verses.text: Also concerning Elisha it is thus written, that, while he played upon his harp, then the spirit came to him and he prophesied and said:—Thus saith the Lord, ye shall not see wind nor rain, yet this valley shall be made many pits.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:379
verses.text: And also when the Shunamite came to him because of her son that was dead, he said thus to her:—The Lord hid it from me and did cause me not to know it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:380
verses.text: Yet, when the King of Israel sent against him to slay him, the Spirit informed him before the messenger came upon him, and he said:—Lo! this son of iniquity has sent to take away my head.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:381
verses.text: And again he made known about the abundance that came about in Samaria the day after.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:382
verses.text: And again the Spirit informed him when Gehazi stole the silver and concealed it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:384
verses.text: Therefore, my beloved, when the Holy Spirit departs from a man who has received it, until it returns and comes to him, then Satan draws near unto that man, to cause him to sin, and that the Holy Spirit may leave him altogether.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:385
verses.text: For as long as the Spirit is with a man, Satan fears to come near him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:386
verses.text: And observe, my beloved, that our Lord also, Who was born from the Spirit, was not tempted by Satan until in baptism He received the Spirit from on high.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:387
verses.text: And then the Spirit led him forth to be tempted by Satan.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:388
verses.text: This, then, is the way with man; that in the hour in which he perceives in himself that he is not fervent in the Spirit, and that his heart is inclining to the thought of this world, he may know that the Spirit is not with him, and may arise and pray and keep vigil that the Spirit of God may come to him, that he be not overcome by the adversary.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:389
verses.text: A thief does not dig into a house, until he sees that its master is departing from it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:390
verses.text: Thus also Satan cannot draw near to that house which is our body, until the Spirit of Christ departs from it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:391
verses.text: And be sure, my beloved, that the thief does not certainly know whether the master of the house is within or not, but first he applies his ear, and looks.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:392
verses.text: If he hears the voice of the master of the house within it saying:—"I have a journey to go," and when he has searched out and seen that the master of the house has set out to perform his business, then the thief comes and digs into the house and steals.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:393
verses.text: But if he hears the voice of the master of the house admonishing and commanding his household to watch and guard his house, and saying to them, "I also am within the house," then the thief will fear and flee, that he may not be taken and captured.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:394
verses.text: Thus also Satan, he has not the knowledge beforehand to know or see when the Spirit will depart, that so he may come to rob the man; but he too listens and watches, and so assails.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:395
verses.text: But if he hears a man in whom Christ dwells speaking shameful words, or enraged, or quarrelling, or contending, then Satan knows that Christ is not with him, and he comes and accomplishes his will in him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:396
verses.text: For Christ dwells in the peaceful and the meek, and lodges in those that fear His word, as He says through the prophet:—On whom shall I look, and in whom shall I dwell, but in the peaceful and the meek who fear My word?  And our Lord said:—Whoever walks in My commandments and keeps My love, We will come to him and make Our abode with him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:397
verses.text: But if he hears from a man that he is on his guard and is praying and meditating in the Law of his Lord by day and by night, then he turns back from him, for he knows that Christ is with him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:398
verses.text: And if thou shouldest say, "How manifold is Satan! for lo! he fights with many;" then hear and learn from that which I proved to thee above concerning Christ, that no matter to what extent He is divided amongst many, yet He is not a whit diminished.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:399
verses.text: For, as the house, through the window of which a little sunlight enters, is altogether illumined, so the man into whom a little of Satan enters, is altogether darkened.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:400
verses.text: Hear that which the Apostle said:—If Satan is transfigured to an angel of light, it is no wonder if his ministers also are transfigured to ministers of righteousness.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:401
verses.text: And again our Lord said to His disciples:—Lo, I have given you authority to tread upon the power of the adversary.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:402
verses.text: And the Scriptures have made known that he has power and also ministers.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:403
verses.text: Moreover Job said concerning him:—God made him to wage his war.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:404
verses.text: These ministers then that he has, he causes to run in the world, to wage war.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:405
verses.text: But be sure that he will not fight openly; because from the time of the coming of our Saviour, (God) has given authority over him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:406
verses.text: But he will surely plunder and steal.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:408
verses.text: But I will explain to thee, my beloved, concerning that word which the Apostle said, by which can be weighed the doctrines that are instruments of the Evil One and doctrines of deceit.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:409
verses.text: For the Apostle said:—There is an animal body and there is a spiritual body, seeing that it is thus written:—The first Adam became a living soul and the second Adam a quickening spirit.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:410
verses.text: So they say that there will be two Adams.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:411
verses.text: But he said:—As we have put on the image of that Adam who was from the earth, so we shall put on the image of that Adam who is from heaven.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:412
verses.text: For Adam who was from the earth was he that sinned, and the Adam who is from heaven is our Saviour, our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:413
verses.text: They then that receive the Spirit of Christ, come into the likeness of the heavenly Adam, Who is our Saviour, our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:414
verses.text: For the animal shall be swallowed up in the spiritual, as I wrote unto thee above.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:415
verses.text: And the man that grieves the spirit of Christ, will be animal in his resurrection; because the heavenly spirit is not with him, that the animal might be swallowed up in it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:416
verses.text: But when he shall arise he shall continue in his natural state, naked of the Spirit.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:417
verses.text: Because he stripped off from him the Spirit of Christ, he shall be given over to utter nakedness.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:418
verses.text: And whosoever honours the Spirit, and it is guarded in him in purity, in that day the Holy Spirit shall protect him, and he shall become altogether spiritual, and shall not be found naked; as the Apostle said:—And when we shall have clothed ourselves, may we not be found naked.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:419
verses.text: And again he said:—We shall all sleep, but in the resurrection we shall not all be changed.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:420
verses.text: And again he said:—This which dies shall put on that which dies not, and this which is corruptible that which is incorruptible, and when this which dies shall have put on that which dies not, and this corruptible that which is incorruptible, then shall be accomplished that word which is written that death is swallowed up by victory.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:421
verses.text: Again he said:—Suddenly as the twinkling of an eye, the dead shall rise incorruptible and we shall be changed.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:422
verses.text: And they who shall be changed shall put on the form of that heavenly Adam and shall become spiritual.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:423
verses.text: And those who shall not be changed, shall continue animal in the created nature of Adam, namely, of dust; and shall continue in their nature in the earth below.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:424
verses.text: And then the heavenly shall be caught up to heaven and the Spirit that they have put on shall cause them to fly, and they shall inherit the kingdom that was prepared for them from the beginning.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:425
verses.text: And they that are animal shall remain on the earth by the weight of their bodies, and shall turn back to Sheol, and there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:427
verses.text: In writing this I have reminded myself, and also thee, my beloved; therefore love virginity, the heavenly portion, the fellowship of the Watchers of heaven.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:428
verses.text: For there is nothing comparable with it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:429
verses.text: And in those that are thus, in them Christ dwells.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:430
verses.text: The time of summer is at hand, and the fig-tree has budded and its leaves have come out—the signs that our Redeemer gave have begun to be fulfilled.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:431
verses.text: For he said:—People shall rise against people and kingdom against kingdom.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:432
verses.text: And there shall be famines and pestilences and terrors from heaven.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:433
verses.text: And lo! all these things are being accomplished in our days.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:435
verses.text: Therefore read in this whatever I have written unto thee, thou and the brethren, the monks that love virginity.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:436
verses.text: And be on thy guard against scorners.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:437
verses.text: For whosoever scorns and mocks his brother, the word that is written in the Gospel fitly applies to him; namely, when our Lord wished to take account with the avaricious and with the Pharisees.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:438
verses.text: For it is written:—Because they loved money, they mocked Him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:439
verses.text: So also now those that do not agree with these things mock in the same way.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:440
verses.text: Read then and learn.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:441
verses.text: Be zealous for reading and for doing.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:442
verses.text: And let the Law of God be thy meditation at every time.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Monks 1:443
verses.text: And when thou hast read this epistle, on thy life (I adjure thee), my beloved, arise and pray, and remember my sinfulness in thy prayer.
